required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Vitamin D and Exercise on Balance in Postmenopausal Women
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Vitamin D and Exercise on Balance in Postmenopausal Women

lead_sponsor.agency: Sultan Abdulhamid Han Training and Research Hospital, Istanbul, Turkey

clinical_study.source: Sultan Abdulhamid Han Training and Research Hospital, Istanbul, Turkey

brief_summary.textblock: In recent years, skeletal and nonskeletal effects of vitamin D has been studied. One of the effects of it was balance and fall prevention. However, these studies were performed on older patients who had not vitamin D deficiency. This study aimed to evaluate the effect of vitamin D replacement therapy and exercise on balance in 50-70 years-old postmenopausal women.

primary_outcome.measure: Postural Stability Test (Biodex) Assessed at Baseline
primary_outcome.description: overall stability index: quantifying the ability to maintain dynamic postural stability The patient's score on this test assesses deviations from center, thus lower index means less instability and better balance. Measures were obtained from 20-sec trials during which participants were asked to maintain an upright standing position on their dominant limb on the unstable surface of the Biodex Stability and Balance System. 0 is the minimum score, but there is no defined maximum score

primary_outcome.measure: Postural Stability Test (Biodex) Assessed After Treatment (8 Weeks)
primary_outcome.description: overall stability index: quantifying the ability to maintain dynamic postural stability. The patient's score on this test assesses deviations from center, thus a lower score is more desirable than a higher score. Measures were obtained from 20-sec trials during which participants were asked to maintain an upright standing position on their dominant limb on the unstable surface of the Biodex Stability and Balance System 0 is the minimum score, but there is no defined maximum score

primary_outcome.measure: Berg Balance Test Assessed at Baseline
primary_outcome.description: 14-item scale designed to measure balance of the older adult in a clinical setting minimum: 0 maximum: 56 A score of 56 indicates functional balance. A score of < 45 indicates individuals may be at greater risk of falling.

primary_outcome.measure: Berg Balance Test Assessed After Treatment (8weeks)
primary_outcome.description: 14-item scale designed to measure balance of the older adult in a clinical setting minimum: 0 maximum: 56 A score of 56 indicates functional balance. A score of < 45 indicates individuals may be at greater risk of falling.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fall Risk Assesment Performed at Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Biodex fall risk screening test: Patients were instructed to maintain the vertical projection with their center of gravity in the midpoint of the platform 0 is the best possible value, higher score reflects increased risk of falling. But there is no defined maximum score

secondary_outcome.measure: Fall Risk Assesment Performed After Treatment (8 Weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Biodex fall risk screening test: Patients were instructed to maintain the vertical projection with their center of gravity in the midpoint of the platform 0° is the best possible value, higher score reflects increased risk of falling. But there is no defined maximum score.

Notthingham Health Profile: general patient reported outcome measure which measures subjective health status. 38 questions in 6 subareas, with each question assigned a weighted value; the sum of all weighted valuesin a given subarea adds up to 100. Overall score is calculated by summing up 6 subdomian scores. Ovearall minimum: 0 maximum: 600 (6X100) Higher scores reflect worse health status

secondary_outcome.measure: Health Status Assessed After Treatment (8 Weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Notthingham Health Profile: general patient reported outcome measure which measures subjective health status. 38 questions in 6 subareas, with each question assigned a weighted value; the sum of all weighted valuesin a given subarea adds up to 100. Overall score is calculated by summing up 6 subdomian scores. Ovearall minimum: 0 maximum: 600 (6X100) Higher scores reflect worse health status.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Vitamin D<10 ng/ml; Vitamin D replacement
arm_group.description: Vitamin D replacement (50.000 IU/per week, for 8 weeks)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Vitamin D<10 ng/ml; Vitamin D replacement and exercise
arm_group.description: Vitamin D replacement (50.000 IU/per week, for 8 weeks) and Core and balance exercises for 8 weeks.
Core and balance exercises for 8 weeks.
Core and balance exercises for 8 weeks.

intervention.description: Vitamin D3 50.000 IU/per week, for 8 weeks
intervention.arm_group_label: Vitamin D<10 ng/ml; Vitamin D replacement
Vitamin D<10 ng/ml; Vitamin D replacement and exercise

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 50-70 years-old postmenopausal women
- Vitamin D level<10 ng/ml and Vitamin D level>30 ng/ml
- Independant in daily life
- Able to do exercise
- Able to read and write in Turkish
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes mellitus,
- Polyneuropathy,
- Spinal stenosis,
- History of fracture or lower extremity operation,
- Rheumatologic diseases,
- History of chemotherapy
- Cognitive impairment

overall_official.affiliation: Sultan Abdulhamid Han Training and Research Hospital

facility.name: Sultan Abdulhamid Han Training and Research Hospital

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

outcome.title: Health Status Assessed at Baseline
outcome.description: Notthingham Health Profile: general patient reported outcome measure which measures subjective health status. 38 questions in 6 subareas, with each question assigned a weighted value; the sum of all weighted valuesin a given subarea adds up to 100. Overall score is calculated by summing up 6 subdomian scores. Ovearall minimum: 0 maximum: 600 (6X100) Higher scores reflect worse health status

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
